Email ä¸»æ—¨: Chun Chung Tse’s US Citizenship Application

Dear Sir or Madam,

I am writing to bring to your attention that Mr. Chun Chung John Tse may be attempting to migrate to the United States. This person is the commander of the Hong Kong Police Public Relations Branch. He has appeared at numerous press conference in Hong Kong speaking on behalf of the Hong Kong Police in regards to the ongoing protests where Hong Kong people are fighting for freedom. As you may be aware already, since June this year, the Hong Kong Police have been making unjust arrests of the protestors, abusing their power, violating human rights, wrongly accusing the protestors and releasing false information to the public. They are of evil nature and cannot be trusted by the Hong Kong people.

Under the U.S. Immigration and Nationality Act Section 212(a)(2)(G), foreign government officials and their immediate family members, who are responsible for, or have carried out particularly severe violations of human rights, are inadmissible for entry into the United States.

I believe that Mr. Tse’s wife, Sirvin Lee, has already obtained a green card. I kindly urge the United States to revoke this family’s green cards and visas and deny their entry to the United States.

Attached are their photos.

Thank you for your attention in this matter.

Regards,
A Hong Kong Citizen

Dear Sir / Madam,

I am writing to bring to your attention that Mr. Tse Chun Chung John may be attempting to migrate to the United States. This person is the Chief Superintendent of the Hong Kong Police Public Relations Branch. He has appeared at numerous press conferences in Hong Kong speaking on behalf of the Hong Kong Police with regards to the ongoing protests where Hong Kong people are fighting for freedom. As you may be aware already, since June this year, the Hong Kong Police have been making unjust arrests of the protestors, abusing their power, violating human rights, wrongly accusing the protestors and releasing false information to the public. They are of evil nature and cannot be trusted by the Hong Kong people. Mr. Tse is one of the core members in the Hong Kong Police Force who should be condemned.

Under the U.S. Immigration and Nationality Act Section 212(a)(2)(G), foreign government officials and their immediate family members, who are responsible for, or have carried out particularly severe violations of human rights, are inadmissible for entry into the United States.

I believe that Mr. Tse’s wife, Ms. Lee So Ling Sirvina, has already obtained a green card. I kindly urge the United States to revoke their family’s green cards and visas and deny their entry to the United States.


Name: TSE CHUN CHUNG JOHN

HK Police IDï¼š623

Residential Addressï¼šFlat 08, Floor 20th, Block J, Kornhill Garden, Hong Kong

HK IDï¼šK578848(A)


Thank you for your attention on this matter.


Kind regards,

A Hong Kong Citizen

Dear Sir or Madam,


I am writing to bring to your attention that Mr. Chun Chung John Tse may be attempting to migrate to the United States. This person is the commander of the Hong Kong Police Public Relations Branch. He has appeared at numerous press conference in Hong Kong speaking on behalf of the Hong Kong Police in regards to the ongoing protests where Hong Kong people are fighting for freedom. As you may be aware already, since June this year, the Hong Kong Police have been making unjust arrests of the protestors, abusing their power, violating human rights, wrongly accusing the protestors and releasing false information to the public. They are of evil nature and cannot be trusted by the Hong Kong people.


Under the U.S. Immigration and Nationality Act Section 212(a)(2)(G), foreign government officials and their immediate family members, who are responsible for, or have carried out particularly severe violations of human rights, are inadmissible for entry into the United States.


I believe that Mr. Tse’s wife, Sirvin Lee, has already obtained a green card. I kindly urge the United States to revoke this family’s green cards and visas and deny their entry to the United States.

Concerns over the application of Mr. Chun Chung John TSE & Ms. So Ling Sirvina LEE

Dear madam/sir,

With regards to the latest findings on the applications for immigration to the United States of America filed by Mr. Chun Chung John TSE, Chief Superintendent of the Hong Kong Police Force (Police Public Relations Branch), and his spouse, Ms. So Ling Sirvina LEE. I, hereby as a citizen of Hong Kong, would like to bring to your attention concerning the involvement of Mr. Tse in the recent anti-human actions and official statements concerning the on-going demonstrations in Hong Kong.

Since the beginning of the Anti-extradition Law campaign in June 2019, the Hong Kong Police Force have been accused of violations against the law of Hong Kong, in particular, abuse of their powers, release of false information, violations of human rights and making of fake evidence against protestors. Mr. Tse, as one of the senior management and spokesperson of the Hong Kong Police Force, he can not be denied for responsibilities in any of the mentioned wrong doings.

“Under the U.S. Immigration & Nationality Act Section 212(a)(2)(G), foreign government officials and their immediate family members, who are responsible for, or have carried out particularly severe violations of human rights, are inadmissible for entry into the United States.”

I strongly believe Mr. Tse has potentially breached the mentioned Act and I sincerely hope you and your colleagues would handle his and/or his spouse’s applications with extra attention and consideration.

Thank you very much for your kind attention and consideration.

Best regards,
A Hong Kong citizen

Dear Sir or Madam,

I am writing to draw your attention to the matter of Mr. Chun Chung John Tse's citizenship application to the US. I am aware that Mr. Tse's wife, Sirvin Lee, has already obtained a green card and Mr. Tse is attempting to migrate to the US with his family. Mr. Tse is the commander of the Hong Kong Police Public Relations Branch who acted as a spokesman of the police in numerous press conferences in Hong Kong in relation to the ongoing protests where Hong Kong people are defending their freedom and high autonomy.

As it is widely covered by the international media, the police have fired gun shot, brutally beaten up and tortured young protesters causing numerous serious and fatal injuries (including bone fracture, cervical vertebra injury, blindness, losing teeth etc). There are complains by the lawyers in Hong Kong which arrested protesters were refused access to legal advice and receive medical treatment. Some of them were locked in a room with extremely low temperature and starved for 20 hours. There are also complains against the police which arrested protesters were beaten up and threaten while in police custoby, famale protesters were humiliated by the police while conducting strip search. These complains have been brought to the magistrate court in Hong Kong by several lawyers. The police's misconduct caused serious violation of the rule of law and human rights. It is totally unacceptable in any civilized society.

Mr. Tse as a commander of the Hong Kong Police Public Relations Branch not only refuses to conduct investigation on the police's misconduct and violence, but also invents hopeless excuses trying to justify the police's use of excessive force. He intends to cover up the truth and all the misbehaviors of the police by lying and spreading fake news in order to blacken the protesters. His dishonest character and shameful actions lead to public anger in Hong Kong.

Under the U.S. Immigration and Nationality Act Section 212(a)(2)(G), foreign government officials and their immediate family members, who are responsible for, or have carried out particularly severe violations of human rights, are inadmissible for entry into the United States.

Given that human right is core value of the US and every civilised country, the US Congress is now deciding to pass the Hong Kong Human Right and Democracy Act, I therefore urge the US to revoke Mr. Tse and his family’s green cards and visas and deny their entry to the United States.

Please find attached their photos for your reference.

Thank you very much for your attention in this matter.

Regards,
A Hong Kong Citizen

Email ä¸»æ—¨: Chun Chung Tse’s US Citizenship Application

Dear Sir or Madam,

I am writing to bring to your attention that Mr. Chun Chung John Tse may be attempting to migrate to the United States. This person is the commander of the Hong Kong Police Public Relations Branch. He has appeared at numerous press conference in Hong Kong speaking on behalf of the Hong Kong Police in regards to the ongoing protests where Hong Kong people are fighting for freedom. As you may be aware already, since June this year, the Hong Kong Police have been making unjust arrests of the protestors, abusing their power, violating human rights, wrongly accusing the protestors and releasing false information to the public. They are of evil nature and cannot be trusted by the Hong Kong people.

Under the U.S. Immigration and Nationality Act Section 212(a)(2)(G), foreign government officials and their immediate family members, who are responsible for, or have carried out particularly severe violations of human rights, are inadmissible for entry into the United States.

I believe that Mr. Tse’s wife, Sirvin Lee, has already obtained a green card. I kindly urge the United States to revoke this family’s green cards and visas and deny their entry to the United States.

Attached are their photos.

Thank you for your attention in this matter.

Regards,
A Hong Kong Citizen
